course_title: Freshman Seminar:Biology: Climate Change and Extinction
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 18 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Freshmen Seminar - Limited to First Year Students Only)
Full Title:  Biology--Could All Life End?  Climate Change and Extinction.  Class Notes:  Do you think life could disappear from our planet?  In this seminar we will explore the topic of climate shift and how this relates to massive extinction events.  We will cover major pre-historical extinctions and modern extinctions caused in many ways by humans.  Non-science majors are welcome.  Students will be assigned two books:  Extinction:  How Life on Earth Nearly Ended 250 Million Years Ago, by Douglas Erwin, 2015, ISBN-13: 978-0691165653 and The Sixth Extinction:  An Unnatural History, by Elizabeth Kolbert, 2015, ISBN-13: 978-1250062185.  There will be additional peer-reviewed journal articles provided by the instructor with the aim to promote class discussion.  Student grades for this seminar will be based on attendance, participation, presentations, and a short, written report due at the end of the semester.
